net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.widget.factory

Interface UiWidgetFactoryDatatype

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AbstractUiWidgetFactoryDatatype
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractUiWidgetFactoryDatatype, UiWidgetFactoryDatatypeSimple

    @ComponentSpecification
public interface UiWidgetFactoryDatatype
extends AbstractUiWidgetFactoryDatatype
    This is the interface for a factory to create widgets for particular datatypes. You will typically use UiContext that extends this interface.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The CDI name.

    • Field Detail

      • CDI_NAME

        The CDI name.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • createForDatatype

        <VALUE> UiWidgetField<VALUE> createForDatatype(Class<VALUE> datatype)
        This method creates a new instance of the field widget to view and edit the given datatype.
        NOTE:
        Using this API is a key for creating a maintainable UI. Define custom datatypes (e.g. CustomerNumber) and use them in your data-model to make it more expressive. For each datatype you are using (including standard datatypes such as String as well as complex datatypes that require a composition of multiple widgets) you can register a sub-factory for each datatype and then consequently use this method in your presentation code to receive the proper field widget. The end-user will thank you for a consistent UI (where the CustomerNumber is viewed and edited in exactly the same way in each dialog). Also you can stay (a lot more) relaxed in case a change request comes up that CustomerNumber has to change its format and validation rules in the entire application (with data-model and UI).
        Specified by:
        createForDatatype in interface AbstractUiWidgetFactoryDatatype
        Type Parameters:
        VALUE - is the generic type of the Datatype.
        Parameters:
        datatype - is the Datatype.
        Returns:
        the new field widget to display and edit the specified datatype.

      • isDatatypeSupported

        boolean isDatatypeSupported(Class<?> type)
        This method determines if the given Class is supported by createForDatatype(Class).
        Parameters:
        type - is the Class potentially reflecting a supported Datatype.
        Returns:
        true if the given Class is supported, false otherwise.
